item.title: 沙特医疗保健公司 Almoosa 首次公开募股获得 460 亿美元订单
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的 Almoosa 公司在沙特首次公开发行 4.5 亿美元的股票，吸引了机构投资者价值 1,730 亿里亚尔（460 亿美元）的订单，这表明市场对在中东上市的公司持续保持兴趣。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Almoosa drew 173 billion riyal ($46 billion) worth of orders from institutional investors for its $450 million initial public offering in the kingdom, in a sign of continued interest in Middle Eastern listings.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司将就 30 亿英镑救援贷款举行关键听证会
item.description: 为确保泰晤士河水务公司（Thames Water）不会耗尽现金而需要的 30 亿英镑（38 亿美元）救援贷款将于周二接受伦敦法官的审查。【原文：A £3 billion ($3.8 billion) rescue loan needed to ensure Thames Water doesn’t run out of cash will be scrutinized by a London judge on Tuesday.】

item.title: 受关税威胁影响，中国资本外流速度创历史新高
item.description: 由于美国提高关税的前景给世界第二大经济体带来了更多风险，中国金融市场上个月遭遇了有史以来最大的资金外流。【原文：China suffered the biggest outflow on record from its financial markets last month as the prospect of higher US tariffs posed more risks for the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 仅限邀请的应用程序使日本社交媒体先驱股价飙升
item.description: 日本移动游戏和社交网络提供商 MIXI 公司周二发布了一款名为 mixi2 的新 SNS，公司股价飙升至六年半以来的新高。【原文：Shares of of MIXI Inc. surged to a six-and-a-half-year high on Tuesday after the Japanese mobile game and social network provider released a new SNS called mixi2.】

item.title: 赞比亚在第四次项目审查后从国际货币基金组织（IMF）获得 1.84 亿美元资金
item.description: 在理事会批准对紧急信贷机制进行第四次审查之后，赞比亚将立即从国际货币基金组织获得约 1.84 亿美元。【原文：Zambia will immediately receive about $184 million from the International Monetary Fund following Board approval of the fourth review of an emergency credit facility.】

item.title: 亚洲货币指数跌至两年低点，因中国和特朗普的影响
item.description: 由于对中国经济前景的悲观情绪以及对特朗普政府将推动美元升值的猜测，亚洲货币指数跌至两年多来的最低点。【原文：An index of Asian currencies fell to the lowest in more than two years amid pessimism over China’s economic outlook and speculation a Trump administration will drive dollar gains.】

item.title: 泡沫红茶制造商重振上市雄心，中国态度被指有所缓和
item.description: 有迹象表明，中国政府正在放松对市场的控制，中国最大的泡泡茶连锁企业之一今年早些时候的首次公开募股令人失望，此后市场情绪有所好转，受此鼓舞，中国的泡泡茶制造商正在重启首次公开募股计划。【原文：China’s bubble-tea makers are reviving plans for initial public offerings, encouraged by signs that Beijing is loosening its grip on the market and sentiment is improving after a disappointing debut by one of the industry’s biggest chains earlier this year.】

item.title: 奢侈品股在中国找到慰藉，以更光明的姿态结束糟糕的一年
item.description: 欧洲奢侈品股票在 12 月份出现反弹，缓解了投资者在过去一年里对中国这一关键市场需求疲软的担忧。【原文：A December rebound in European luxury-goods stocks is easing the pain for investors after a year characterized by concerns over weakening demand in the key market of China.】

item.title: 通胀持续，东欧不再降息
item.description: 由于预期唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫后可能出现动荡，东欧可能会避开在主要经济体中蔓延的货币宽松浪潮。【原文：Eastern Europe is likely to sidestep a wave of monetary easing that’s spreading across major economies in anticipation of potential turmoil as Donald Trump returns to the White House.】

item.title: 路透社称中国计划在 2025 年实现约 5%的 GDP 目标
item.description: 路透社援引未具名消息人士的话报道称，中国将把明年的年度增长目标设定为 5%左右，并计划把预算赤字占国内生产总值的比例提高到 4%。【原文：China will set an annual growth goal of about 5% for next year and plans to raise the budget deficit to 4% of gross domestic product, Reuters reported citing unnamed sources.】

item.title: 在房地产市场低迷之际，侨福芳草地寻求出售北京标志性购物中心
item.description: 由于中国房地产长期低迷，开发商的现金流受到影响，侨福集团正在出售其位于北京的地标性商业综合体。【原文：Parkview Group is putting its landmark commercial complex in Beijing up for sale as China’s prolonged property slump weighs on the developer’s cash flow.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴出售银泰百货将亏损 13 亿美元
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司已同意以约 10 亿美元的价格将旗下的银泰百货业务出售给 Youngor Fashion Co.【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. has agreed to sell its Intime department store business to Youngor Fashion Co. for around $1 billion in a move to offload non-core assets.】

item.title: 中国限制农作物进口导致大豆短缺
item.description: 据知情贸易商称，中国政府今年限制农产品进口的努力导致海关等待时间比往常更长，从而造成中国南部大豆短缺。【原文：The Chinese government’s efforts to limit agricultural imports this year is causing a soybean shortage in the south of the country by leading to longer-than-usual wait times at customs, according to traders with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特鲁多政府在副手写下严厉辞职信后在加拿大举步维艰
item.description: 总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）信任的副手、财政部长克里斯蒂娅-弗里兰（Chrystia Freeland）周一发表了一封措辞尖锐的辞职信，使他的政府陷入危机，在最糟糕的时刻，他的力量被削弱了。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s administration was thrown into crisis when his trusted deputy, Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland, published a withering resignation letter on Monday that left him weakened at the worst possible time.】

item.title: 尽管有经济刺激政策，外国首席执行官对中国的信心仍在下滑
item.description: 一项衡量中国首席执行官信心的重要指标显示，自大流行病以来，中国首次出现了悲观情绪，即使在国家采取了一系列刺激措施之后也是如此。【原文：A key measure of CEO confidence in China signaled pessimism for the first time since the pandemic even after the nation unleashed a raft of stimulus measures.】

item.title: 中国总理要求抓紧落实经济工作
item.description: 中国总理李强敦促政府官员迅速落实明年的主要经济任务，此前最高领导人曾表示将在 2025 年采取更强有力的刺激措施。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang urged government officials to swiftly carry out key economic tasks for the coming year, after top leaders signaled stronger stimulus for 2025.】

item.title: BRS 称俄罗斯石油正由更多主流油轮运送
item.description: 据 BRS Shipbrokers 称，在石油价格滑落至符合价格上限的水平后，作为主流船队一部分的油轮重新开始装载俄罗斯原油。【原文：There’s been a resurgence of tankers that are part of the mainstream fleet loading Russian crude after oil slipped closer to price-cap compliant levels, according to BRS Shipbrokers.】

item.title: 监管机构就抵押问题施压，台湾银行寻求存款
item.description: 台湾最大的银行正在加大力度吸引个人和公司存款，以回应监管机构要求它们降低追踪其在岛内热门房地产市场风险敞口的关键比率的要求。【原文：Taiwan’s biggest banks are stepping up efforts to lure deposits from both individuals and companies, responding to regulator demands for them to reduce a key ratio tracking their exposure to the island’s hot housing market.】

item.title: 据说麦考密克正在洽谈以 10 亿美元的估值收购杜克梅奥的所有者绍尔品牌公司
item.description: 据知情人士透露，麦考密克公司（McCormick & Co.【原文：McCormick & Co. is in talks to acquire Sauer Brands Inc. from Falfurrias Capital Partners, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚养老金管理局称，澳大利亚养老金对私人市场监督不力
item.description: 澳大利亚养老基金监管机构发现，快速增长的 4.1 万亿澳元（2.6 万亿美元）行业对私募市场估值的监管不力，并警告称，如果该行业不能改善其治理和流动性风险管理，监管机构可能会采取进一步行动。【原文：An Australian pension fund regulator found the fast-growing A$4.1 trillion ($2.6 trillion) industry has weak oversight of private markets valuations, warning it may take further action if the sector fails to improve its governance and liquidity risk management.】

item.title: 泛兄弟公司完成 5.37 亿美元债务重组
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在与债权人进行了七个月的谈判后，陷入困境的纺织巨头PT Pan Brothers公司的债务重组已接近尾声，该公司正努力避免成为今年第二家被宣布破产的印尼服装制造商。【原文：Distressed textile giant PT Pan Brothers is closing in on its debt restructuring after seven months of negotiation with creditors, according to people familiar with the matter, as it works to avoid becoming the second Indonesian clothesmaker to be declared bankrupt this year.】

item.title: 芯片制造商 Kioxia 在东京繁忙的 IPO 竞技场上面临艰难首秀
item.description: 在炙手可热的日本市场，Kioxia 控股公司本应是一个令人难以抗拒的新秀，预示着一家拥有强大支持者和历史悠久的本土芯片制造商的崛起。它可能会受到比预期更冷的欢迎。【原文：Kioxia Holdings Corp. was supposed to be an irresistible debutant in a hot Japanese market, heralding the rise of a homegrown chipmaker with big backers and a storied pedigree. It may get a cooler reception than anticipated.】

item.title: 澳大利亚石墨生产商获得 7.55 亿美元的美国工厂融资，业绩大幅增长
item.description: 澳大利亚合成石墨生产商 Novonix Ltd. 获得美国能源部 7.55 亿美元的有条件贷款，用于在田纳西州建造一座生产厂，随后该公司股价大涨。【原文：Shares in Australian synthetic graphite maker Novonix Ltd. surged after it received a conditional $755 million loan from the US Department of Energy to build a manufacturing plant in Tennessee.】

item.title: 特朗普重返白宫，亚洲货币走势值得关注
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普政府执政的情况下，美元将进一步走高，因此亚洲货币的疲软使一些关键价位成为人们关注的焦点。【原文：The weakness in Asian currencies is bringing some key levels into view as traders brace for further dollar gains under a Donald Trump administration.】

item.title: 新西兰面临更大的预算赤字，稍后将恢复盈余
item.description: 由于长期的经济衰退和生产力低下打击了税收，新西兰政府正面临着更严重的预算赤字和恢复盈余的延迟。【原文：New Zealand’s government is facing deeper budget deficits and a delayed return to surplus as a prolonged economic downturn and poor productivity hit tax revenue.】

item.title: 印尼、泰国将暂停加息：决策指南
item.description: 东南亚两个最大经济体的央行预计将在本周保持利率稳定，印尼将集中精力支持疲软的印尼盾，而泰国央行仍将坚持中性立场以促进经济增长。【原文：The central banks of Southeast Asia’s two biggest economies are expected to keep rates steady this week, with Indonesia razor-focused on supporting the weakening rupiah and Thailand’s central bank still sticking to its neutral stance to bolster growth.】
